required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Three Year, Prospective, Open-label, Study To Evaluate Clinical Efficacy, Safety And Tolerability Of Atorvastatin In Children And Adolescents With Heterozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to characterize three year descriptive growth and development (ie, height, weight, body mass index, Tanner Stage) and efficacy of cholesterol reduction in pediatric subjects with Heterozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia receiving atorvastatin treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C; Millimoles Per Liter [mMol/L]) During the Study
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast). Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in LDL-C
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast).

primary_outcome.measure: High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C; mMol/L) During the Study
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast). Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in HDL-C
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast).

primary_outcome.measure: Total Cholesterol (mMol/L) During the Study
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast). Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Cholesterol
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast).

primary_outcome.measure: Trigylcerides (mMol/L) During the Study
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast). Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Trigylcerides
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast).

primary_outcome.measure: Very Low-Density Lipoprotein (VLDL; mMol/L) During the Study
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast). Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in VLDL
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast).

primary_outcome.measure: Apoliprotein A-1 (Apo A-1; Grams Per Liter [g/L]) During the Study
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast). Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Apo A-1
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast).

primary_outcome.measure: Apoliprotein B (Apo B; g/L) During the Study
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast). Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Apo B
primary_outcome.description: Assessments were performed in the fasting state (minimum 10-hour fast).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Shift From Baseline in Tanner_Stage by Timepoint and Baseline Tanner_Stage
primary_outcome.description: Tanner_Stage was assessed based on 2 components by gender, pubic hair and breasts for females and pubic hair and genitalia for males. If these values of components were not same, then the Tanner_Stage had the higher value of 2 components for each gender by visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Height (Centimeters [cm]) During the Study: Males
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of height changes during the study. Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Height: Males
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of height changes during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Height (cm) During the Study: Females
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of height changes during the study. Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Height: Females
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of height changes during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Weight (Kilograms [kg]) During the Study: Males
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of weight changes during the study. Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Weight: Males
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of weight changes during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Weight (kg) During the Study: Females
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of weight changes during the study. Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Weight: Females
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of weight changes during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Body Mass Index (BMI in kg Per Square Meter [kg/m^2]) During the Study: Males
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of BMI changes during the study. Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in BMI: Males
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of BMI changes during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: BMI (kg/m^2) During the Study: Females
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of BMI changes during the study. Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in BMI: Females
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of BMI changes during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Age (Years) During the Study: Males
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of age during the study. Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Age: Males
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of age during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Age (Years) During the Study: Females
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of age during the study. Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Age: Females
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assessment of age during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Flow-Mediated Dilatation (FMD) During the Study
primary_outcome.description: Percent (%) FMD was calculated as (hyperemic diameter minus resting diameter) divided by the resting diameter multiplied by 100. Change from baseline was also determined.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in FMD
primary_outcome.description: Percent (%) FMD was calculated as (hyperemic diameter minus resting diameter) divided by the resting diameter multiplied by 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Overall Expected Maturation and Development Consistent With Expectations as Assessed by the Investigator
Percentage of Participants by Study Drug Compliance Category
secondary_outcome.description: Compliance to study drug was categorized as <80%, 80% - 120%, and greater than (>) 120%.

arm_group.description: All subjects will be treated with atorvastatin

intervention.description: Atorvastatin tablets or chewable tablets, 5, 10, 20, 40 mg strengths, once daily, for three years (an 80 mg maximum daily dose is delivered by taking two 40 mg strengths, once daily)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia, ages 6-15, LDL greater than 4 mmol/l
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active liver disease or hepatic dysfunction, or persistent elevations of serum transaminases exceeding three times the upper limit of normal (ULN).
Female of childbearing potential who is not using adequate contraceptive measures or any female who is pregnant or breastfeeding. Any female who becomes pregnant during study participation will be immediately discontinued from treatment and counseled appropriately about the in utero exposure.
Known hypersensitivities to HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors

Metabolicka ambulancia, 2. Detská klinika Lekárskej fakulty Univerzity Komenského
Hospital Santa Creu I Sant Pau
Hacettepe University Medical Faculty. Department of Pediatrics. Nutrition and Metabolism Unit

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Atorvastatin (5-80 mg): Tanner_Stage 1
group.description: Participants aged 6 to less than (<)10 years, at Tanner_Stage 1 received an initial dose of atorvastatin tablets, 5 milligrams per day (mg/day), orally (PO), through Week 4; after Week 4, dose may have been doubled to 10 mg/day, with subsequent doubling to 20 mg/day (as necessary; maximum dose was 80 mg/day), PO, if target low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) (<3.35 millimoles per liter [mmol/L]) was not attained.

group.title: Atorvastatin (10-80 mg): Tanner_Stage 2+
group.description: Participants aged greater than or equal to (≥) 10 to 15 years, at Tanner_Stage 2+ received an initial dose of atorvastatin tablets, 10 mg/day, PO, through Week 4; after Week 4, dose may have been doubled to 20 mg/day, with subsequent doubling to 40 mg/day (as necessary; maximum dose was 80 mg/day), PO, if target LDL-C (<3.35 mmol/L) was not attained.

baseline.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all participants who took at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Shift From Baseline in Tanner_Stage by Timepoint and Baseline Tanner_Stage
outcome.description: Tanner_Stage was assessed based on 2 components by gender, pubic hair and breasts for females and pubic hair and genitalia for males. If these values of components were not same, then the Tanner_Stage had the higher value of 2 components for each gender by visit.
outcome.population: FAS; n=number of participants assessed for the specific parameter at a given visit.

group.title: Atorvastatin (5-80 mg): Baseline Tanner_Stage 1
group.description: Participants aged 6 to <10 years, at Tanner_Stage 1 received an initial dose of atorvastatin tablets, 5 mg/day, PO, through Week 4; after Week 4, dose may have been doubled to 10 mg/day, PO, with subsequent doubling to 20 mg/day (as necessary; maximum dose was 80 mg/day), PO, if target LDL-C (<3.35 mmol/L) was not attained.

group.title: Atorvastatin (10-80 mg): Baseline Tanner_Stage 2
group.description: Participants aged ≥10 to 15 years, at Tanner_Stage 2 received an initial dose of atorvastatin tablets, 10 mg/day, PO, through Week 4; after Week 4, dose may have been doubled to 20 mg/day, with subsequent doubling to 40 mg/day (as necessary; maximum dose was 80 mg/day), PO, if target LDL-C (<3.35 mmol/L) was not attained.

outcome.title: Flow-Mediated Dilatation (FMD) During the Study
outcome.description: Percent (%) FMD was calculated as (hyperemic diameter minus resting diameter) divided by the resting diameter multiplied by 100. Change from baseline was also determined.
outcome.population: FMD Set: all participants enrolled in the FMD study who had at least baseline FMD measurements. n=number of participants assessed for the specified parameter at a given visit.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants by Study Drug Compliance Category
outcome.description: Compliance to study drug was categorized as <80%, 80% - 120%, and greater than (>) 120%.
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set: all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug; n=number of participants assessed for the specified parameter at a given visit.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious AE (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in 1 participant and as nonserious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Atorvastatin (5-80 mg): Tanner_Stage 1
group.description: Participants aged 6 to <10 years, at Tanner_Stage 1 received an initial dose of atorvastatin tablets, 5 mg/day, PO, through Week 4; after Week 4, dose may have been doubled to 10 mg/day, with subsequent doubling to 20 mg/day (as necessary; maximum dose was 80 mg/day), PO, if target LDL-C (<3.35 mmol/L) was not attained.

group.title: Atorvastatin (10-80 mg): Tanner_Stage 2+
group.description: Participants aged ≥10 to 15 years, at Tanner_Stage 2+ received an initial dose of atorvastatin tablets, 10 mg/day, PO, through Week 4; after Week 4, dose may have been doubled to 20 mg/day, with subsequent doubling to 40 mg/day (as necessary; maximum dose was 80 mg/day), PO, if target LDL-C (<3.35 mmol/L) was not attained.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
